entry.title: Tabi Elegante
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cypher Roastary
Type: Coffee
Price: 65.00 - 105.00 (2 variants)

FARM HISTORY

Their journey with specialty coffee production in 2002 with the Tabi Indio. Next was Java as they attempted to produce some rare and exotic varietals hard to find in Colombia. They planted Java, Tabi Co., and Geisha in mid-2015 and started the first cherry-picking in March-April of 2017. Later, they started trying different fermentation and drying processes including naturals, honey, and semi-washed. Today they have an array of specialty coffees with great notes to indulge your senses.

CypherED Profile

Jasmine, Candied apple, stone fruits, smooth and silky, sweet vanilla finish

Facts

Origin: Colombia

Region: Trujillo, Valle del Cauca

Altitude: 1,650 - 1,700 m

Varietal: Tabi-Indo

Process: Semi-Washed

entry.title: Santa Gertrudis Caturra Natural
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cypher Roastery
Type: Coffee
Price: 75.00 - 125.00 (2 variants)

FARM history

Hacienda Santa Gertrudis neighbours Podocarpus National Park and is only minutes away from Vilcabamba, a town famous internationally for its pleasant climate and the longevity of its inhabitants.

At 1,600m – 1,700 high, the farm cultivates several varietals of Arabica coffee such as Caturra, Yellow Catuaí, Geisha, Sidra, SL28, Typica and Bourbon.

In 1954, Luis Emilio Eguiguren planted the first coffee trees on the farm and then started selling his beans in surrounding markets. Since then, he introduced innovations to improve the quality of his coffee and post-harvest processing, both of which made him worthy of recognition by the industry. Six decades later, the farm’s curiosity still drives the constant quest for excellence in the cup.

CypherED Profile

Stone fruits, cinnamon, caramel, cacao nibs, round silky body, chocolate fudge aftertaste.

Facts

Origin: Ecuador

Region: Loja Province

Farm: Hacienda Santa Gertrudis

Altitude: 1,600 - 1,700 m

Varietal: Caturra

Process: Natural

entry.title: Mr. Brown
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cypher Roastery
Type: Coffee
Price: 65.00 - 105.00 (2 variants)

FARM HISTORY

The Andrade Family is one of the oldest coffee-producing families in Cerrado Mineiro region, at the Minas Gerais state in Brazil. The Capim Branco Farm has deeds dating back to 1901. Nowadays, following the footsteps of their ancestors, the brothers Ismael and Eduardo Andrade are the owners, producing coffee with passion and respect for the environment and people for over a century.


In the early 90's they decided to expand production, volume Improvement, and quality all together, acquiring the São Silvestre Farm in Serra do Salitre, also part of Cerrado Mineiro - Minas Gerais state. The farm and its Terroir are situated in an altitude ranging between 1100 - 1220 meters, with perfectly balanced wet and dry seasons.

With Dolce Cerrado, we offer a blend of both Terroirs, São Silvestre and Capim Branco, delivering a coffee with all the striking features of the Cerrado Mineiro region. A much appreciated coffee for espresso extractions.

CypherED Profile

Sweet tobacco, dense dark chocolate, soft spice lingering finish.

Facts

Origin: Brazil
Region: Cerrado Mineiro
Producer: Sao Silvestre
Altitude: 1,220 m
Varietal: Yellow Icatú
Process: Anaerobic Cryo Fermentation

The Andrade Family is one of the oldest coffee-producing families in Cerrado Mineiro region, at the Minas Gerais state in Brazil. The Capim Branco Farm has deeds dating back to 1901. Nowadays, following the footsteps of their ancestors, the brothers Ismael and Eduardo Andrade are the owners, producing coffee with passion and respect for the environment and people for over a century.

The farm and its Terroir are situated in an altitude ranging between 1100 - 1220 meters, with perfectly balanced wet and dry seasons.

With Dolce Cerrado, we offer a blend of both Terroirs, São Silvestre and Capim Branco, delivering a coffee with all the striking features of the Cerrado Mineiro region. A much appreciated coffee for espresso extractions.

entry.title: Mr. Red
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cypher Roastery
Type: Coffee
Price: 65.00 - 105.00 (2 variants)

FARM HISTORY

It all started with his grandfather Alexandre Garcia Capelo, who was a small coffee producer. His son, Antonio Wander Garcia, is an agricultural engineer researcher in fertility area in coffee and nutrition, following in the footsteps of his father, he became a producer who dedicated his life to know and produce coffee.

Now, he is helped by his son André Luiz Alvarenga Garcia who is also an agricultural engineer, a researcher specialized in pruning and producing.

Throughout this story with the coffee cultivation, many stories were lived and the family remained united in this activity that generated prosperity not only to them but also to all who have been connected, always seeking respect, humility, and dignity.

The family is focused on improving the living conditions of all workers and their families. Overtime, the green areas were expanded, with insulation and planting trees along the springs.

Changes such as the use of organic matter to the revitalization of the coffee plantations, reducing the use of agrochemicals, and constant testing of new crops with resistance to rust, drought and nematodes are made.

CypherED Profile

Tamarind, cacao nibs, cola lime, peppery finish

Facts

Origin: Brazil
Region: Sul de Minas
Producer: Vale do Sol
Altitude: 860 m – 950 m

Varietal: Icatu
Process: 76 Hours Natural Anaerobic

entry.title: Mr. Pink
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cypher Roastery
Type: Coffee
Price: 65.00 - 105.00 (2 variants)

FARM HISTORY

The sanctuary farm is a project that was born from a goal of being ahead of market trends. It is not easy to begin planning with plans to bring coffee from different regions of the world to generate a new profile of Brazilian coffee.

The coffees that grown here are reflections of the obstinacy of Luiz Paulo and his partners. Today, in addition to the traditional Brazilian varieties (like yellow bourbon), the farm has more than 30 exotic varieties of coffee, differentiated cultivation practices (such as shade plantation), and innovative processes (New Flavors).

The South Shrine is next to one of the most traditional farms in Carmo de Minas, Sisters Pereira, where it has its coffee benefited.

CypherED Profile

Honeyed black tea, pomegranate, bubbly, balanced, and clean finish.

Facts

Origin: Brazil
Region: Carmo de Minas
Producer: Fazenda Santuário Sul

Altitude: 1,380m – 1,430 m
Varietal: SL 28
Process: Honey

entry.title: Furaha
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cypher Roastery
Type: Coffee
Price: 65.00 - 105.00 (2 variants)

FARM HISTORY

Othaya Farmers’ Co-operative Society Limited is situated about 150km north of Kenya's capital of Nairobi in Othaya Town, Nyeri County. Othaya is sandwiched between Mt. Kenya and the Aberdare Ranges, at an altitude of 1828 meters (approximately 6000 feet) above sea level. This is where the world-famous Arabica coffee is grown. The Society was registered in 1956 as a coffee marketing society with an initial membership of 250 farmers. Currently, the Society has 19 factories with a total membership of 15,000 small scale farmers. The Society has coffee nurseries for coffee seedlings, 19 coffee factories/wet mills and store outlets in each of the wet mills for provision of farm inputs. The Society also has a dry mill that serves the 19 coffee factories through finance raised by selling shares to the members. All coffee from Othaya Farmers’ Co-operative Society is Fairtrade Certified. One of the factories belonging to this giant co-operative is Mahiga factory.


Mahiha station was built in 1962 and is in Rukira village at an altitude of 1813 meters above sea level on latitude 00.52512° South and longitude 036.93390° east. The station is located along Mumwe River and utilizes water from the river to pulp cherry. The river originates from the Aberdare Ranges.

CypherED Profile

Black currant, apricot, tea-like, silky body, elegant lingering zesty finish

Facts

Origin: Kenya

Region: Nyeri

Altitude: 1,813 m

Varietal: SL28

Process: Washed

entry.title: SAN JOSE NATURAL
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cypher Roastery
Type: Coffee
Price: 65.00 - 105.00 (2 variants)

producer history

San Jose was purchased from a Nicaraguan bank in 2003. The bank had claimed that the farm was well-maintained, however, a visit by the owners made it clear that the farm had been near-abandoned. Notwithstanding the bank’s neglect, they saw great potential in it. It was purchased mostly due to its relatively high altitude for Nicaragua. Once the soil was analyzed by Anacafe in Guatemala, it was discovered that the soil has a PH level of 6. This meant that coffee shrubs could assimilate more easily to the soil’s nutritional content. This advantage led to the planting of many different varieties, such as Gesha, Javanica, and Yellow Pacamara

CypherED Profile

Red grapes, purple plum, creamy chocolate fudge, smooth round body, soft spice lingering finish

Facts

Origin: Nicaragua

Region: Jinotega

Farm: San Jose Farm

Altitude: 1,300 - 1,400 m

Varietal: Javanica

Process: Natural Anaerobic

entry.title: El Colibri
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cypher Roastery
Type: Coffee
Price: 65.00 - 105.00 (2 variants)

FARM HISTORY

Mirna Lizeth Domínguez Márquez is part of the third coffee generation in her family, her parents María Nery Márquez and Alfonso Domínguez, both coffee producers were famous for their passion and dedication and have cultivated and lived for coffee. At a very young age, Mirna got involved in the field and awakened her passion for coffee, generating expectations and inspiring her in new challenges of becoming a coffee producer that owns her own farm, faithfully believing that her dreams could be fulfilled, with a lot of effort, work and dedication. In 2018 she achieved her goal of being the owner of "Colibrí" farm as it has a lot of vegetation and attracts many types of birds that delight them with their song and their colorful plumage. Currently, she gets the pleasure visiting her farm in the company of her 11-year-old daughter, who is her inspiration to chase and develop her dreams and transmit to her the culture and passion for coffee, the countryside, and nature that are part of life.

 

CypherED Profile

Bold fruity aromas, dark cherry, and baked plum flavors, dense, juicy, and silky sweet finish.

Facts

Origin: Honduras

Region: Montecillos

Farm: El Colibri

Altitude: 1,600 m

Varietal: Lempira

Process: Natural

entry.title: TENDI
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cypher Roastery
Type: Coffee
Price: 65.00 - 105.00 (2 variants)

Tano Batak coffee comes from the Lintong and Dolok Sanggul regions near South Lake Toba in Sumatra. At 1,400 to 1,550 masl, this region has the highest coffee growing altitudes in North Sumatra. Olam Specialty Coffee works with six collectors that buy coffee directly from small farmers and in weekly village markets. The collectors wet hull the coffee at 28-32% moisture and then dry it in green houses. Once around 11-12% moisture, they run the coffee over densametric tables before sending it to Olam in Medan for hand sorting. Given the exceptional quality of these coffees, we process each lot separately as microlots.

CypherED Profile

Sweet tobacco aromas, vanilla, white grapefruit, melon, molasses, very syrupy body, dark chocolate finish

Facts

Origin: Indonesia 

Region: Lintong & Dolok Sanggul

Altitude: 1,400 m

Varietal: Catimor

Process: Wet hulled

entry.title: Amelia
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cypher Roastery
Type: Coffee
Price: 65.00 - 105.00 (2 variants)

FARM HISTORY

Finca Lerida’s reputation is as old as the first coffee that Panama exported to Germany back in 1929. The high-quality coffee produced inside this exceptional plantation made its international buyers realize that there was more to Panama than just it’s famous Canal. This was, and still is, Finca Lerida.

Panama Lerida Estate is one of the oldest coffee farms in Panama, founded by Toleff Boche Monniche in the 1920s. The family farm was sold to the Collins family in 1957. The Collins family, and particularly John Collins, were instrumental in changing the worldwide perception of coffee in Panama. In early Best of Panama competitions in the early 2000s, the Lerida Estate set the standard for what coffee in Panama can taste like. This was even before the famous Geisha variety was found in Panama.

Finca Lerida then was separated by lots, understanding the differences created by the microclimates and conditions within the farm.

Esplendorosa Estate was planted with Geisha due to its high altitude and great conditions for Geisha development. Its size made it Geisha heaven and has won many prizes in the Best Of Panama competition.

Almost 100 years since it started exporting coffee, Finca Lerida still maintains the trademarked quality that made it among Panama's most famous names in the world of coffee. 

CypherED Profile

Vibrant dark plum, blueberry jam, hints of lavender and dark chocolate, round body, honeyed finish.

Facts

Origin: Panama

Region: Boquete, Chiriquí

Farm: Lerida Estate

Altitude: 1,600 - 1,800 m

Varietal: Catuai

Process: Natural

entry.title: CHANZO
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cypher Roastery
Type: Coffee
Price: 65.00 - 105.00 (2 variants)

FARM HISTORY

This coffee comes from the lush Volcanic soils of the RWENZORI Mountain range in Western Uganda, bordering the D.R. Congo. Sourced directly from a community of 35 Lead Farmers, along the steep slopes, who grow and harvest the cherries on their small farms before delivering only the juiciest of red cherries to a central drying centre. Cherries are thinly spread on a raised bed, where they mature and dry for 20-30 days. The Micro Lot project was created in 2016, initially has a demonstration farm, to educate farmers on Speciality preparation, with this coffee representing their first-ever production. Cypher Urban Roastery is one of only 3 roasters worldwide to have the unique opportunity to introduce a very unique coffee to the coffee-loving public.

 

Just in case you were wondering why is this amazing coffee was named "Chanzo", it's because it means "The Source" in Swahili. The Rwenzori mountain in the Western Uganda range is the source of the Nile river.

CypherED Profile

Juicy berries, mango, rich creamy body, smooth & sweet finish

Facts

Origin: Uganda

Subregion: Kyamukube

Altitude: 1,900m

Varietal: SL.14 & SL.28

Process: Natural

 

END
